alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 7:30AM EST until November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Henderson County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated periodic heavier showers likely to redevelop and overspread the area this morning. Developing out of bank conditions are expected on area tributaries feeding the French Broad and Green Rivers. This is especially likely on Mud Creek and smaller drainages throughout greater Hendersonville. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana, Tuxedo, Crab Creek, Edneyville and Gerton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
